column1: Sunken fontanelles are an obvious curving in of the "soft spot" in an infant's head.
There are normally several fontanelles on a newborn's skull.
The provider will perform a physical exam and ask questions about the child's symptoms and medical history, such as: - When did you first notice that the fontanelle looked sunken?
- Has the baby been ill, especially with vomiting, diarrhea, or excessive sweating?
